title: HS30086: Economics Of Informal Sector - Quick Facts
text:
HS30086
Course name | Economics Of Informal Sector
Offered by | Humanities & Social Sciences
Credits | 3
L-T-P | 3-0-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | Autumn

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisites: None Course ContentsConcepts and Definitions; Approaches to Development of the Urban Informal Sector; Labour Absorption in Urban Sectors and Dualism in Urban Economy: Theoretical and Policy issues-Lewis Theory, Todaros Model, Fei and Ranis Model; Migration and Informal sector; Production and Market Relations: Formal and Informal Sector Linkage- Forward and Backward; The Informal sector and the Income Distribution- The Inverted U Curve; Informal Sector Vs Growth, Employment and Environment; Informal Markets - A Study of the Rural Sector- Land, Labour, Credit and Insurance; Response of Informal Sector to Trade Liberalization; Informal sector and Development Policy Dilemma; Country Studies.
